intro: Mesembryanthemum annulatum, commonly known as the annual ice plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in arid environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, appearing in clusters during the warmer months. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its drought tolerance and attractive appearance.
